name: Waikiki Prince

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We went to Hawaii thinking we would only be in the hotel to sleep, so we didn't really care what kind of place we stayed in. We booked our rooms at Waikiki Prince because of the cheap rates, not really expecting much when we go there.
reviews.title: Exellent place, excellent location, excellent price!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Much to our surprise, our room was much more than we expected. We had a the large kitchen room and it was well-equipped, clean and very comfortable. Our balcony even had a view of Waikiki Beach.
reviews.title: A great bargain: clean, close to the beach and helpful staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We highly recommend the Waikiki Prince to anyone who travels to Honolulu.
reviews.title: Good price and location

likes.disliked: — Lift does not reach sixth floor where we stayed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only negative - if you want to call it that - is the elevator on the six-story building only goes to the fifth floor. If you're on the top floor, you have to get out on 5 and walk up to the top floor. This would only be an issue with someone with mobility issues. It was not a problem for us. And after eating at one of the many excellent restaurants within a block of the hotel, we appreciated the bit of exercise getting back to our room.
reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I know where I'll be staying on our next Honolulu trip!
reviews.title: Great value, friendly service

likes.disliked: — noise level from aircon of adjacent shop

reviews.text: I stayed here with my husband and his parents for a week in the middle of Feb 2008. We had just finished travelling around the States for 6 weeks and were very pleased with what this hotel offered us. Yes it is basic but they are honest about this from the start and you can't expect much for the price you are paying, however it is in a great location, the staff are friendly and the room is clean. I would stay here again and would recommend it to anyone wanting honest accommodation in the middle of Waikiki for a fraction of the price.
reviews.title: Great value and location

reviews.text: I am a budget minded traveler and the Waikiki Prince was a terrific choice. I had read many of the reviews and decided to stay at the Waikiki Prince because of the reviews, the price, and the location. I could not have been more pleased. The room was comfortable, the balcony and view were great, the employees were always helpful, and the hotel is close to all the Waikiki attractions including just a couple of blocks to the beach. I have already started thinking about my next Hawaii trip and that will include staying at the Waikiki Prince.
reviews.title: Terrific Choice

reviews.text: This IS a budget hotel, and a very nice clean one. The unit was small, but just fine and included a kitchenette that was well stocked. My bed was a serta pillow top and the moment I hit the sack I felt great. Quiet air con, though I only used it during the day once, as early Feb was pretty cool. No obnoxious fragranced smells (like the Sheraton on Kauai). No noises at night (and the hotel is in a rather quiet part of Waikiki) - and I left the windows open every night. There was one regular dump truck in the early morning, but nothing like the hordes of trucks on the mauka side of the Sheraton and Halekulani area. And no clubs emptying at 4:00AM like on Lewers or on Kuhio St. more to the west side.
reviews.title: Nice and comfy.

likes.disliked: — One must remember that this is a budget hotel, there is NO pool, night life etc

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly staff and all went well.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel/Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife & I had just returned from our 12th trip to Hawaii (my 15th). We have lost track of how many hotels on Oahu, Maui, Big Island & Kauai we've stayed at and there is no better all around hotel than the Waikiki Prince for the price, location & staff. This was the 2nd time we stayed there, 7 wks in Dec/06 to Feb/07 and 7 wks in Nov/07 to Jan/08. We are booked again for 8 wks in Nov/08 to Jan/09. Yes the Waikiki Prince hotel area can be noisy at times but the whole Waikiki area is noisy. The rooms are on the small side but so is the price. Mozah, Ashley & Lincoln could not be more helpful. Ashley save us $50.00 on a 1-day car rental with one phone call for us. We have stayed in 5 different rooms over our 14 wks there and none of them was a problem with bugs. We had bugs in more expensive hotels. We were on the 6th floor for the last 7 wks. We used the remote control for the air-conditioner so there was no need to stand on the bed. You can spend your money while you're asleep or while you're awake, if you want to spend it awake, stay at the Prince Hotel. If you're coming from Canada take a box of Prudy's chocolate for the staff. Can't wait to go back.
reviews.title: Great value

likes.disliked: — Rooms aren't fancy, but that's ok

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 5 nights & loved the location, it's a couple of minutes walk to the beach & right in the thick of it as far as all of the shops & restaurants go.
reviews.title: Perfect location, good little budget hotel

likes.liked: — Proximity to the famous Wakki Beach

reviews.text: We went for a small double room which was small, but not cramped. There were a couple of things that weren't perfect, but as far as budget accommodation goes, you can't go wrong with this place.
reviews.title: Great deal close to the beach

likes.disliked: — Bright sun through windows in the morning, but that wasn't that bad!

reviews.text: Strangely our room had a bit of a lack of curtains, one window had just a thin net curtain & the other window was made up of frosted, slatted plastic. The end result was that we couldn't make it that dark & woke up when the sun rose at 6am every morning. The air con unit was ridiculously noisy, to the point that you really couldn't have it on over night & there was quite a bit of noise coming from the street below. I'd definitely bring a sleeping mask & some ear plugs as these were my saviours!
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's an old hotel & rightly knows that it's budget accommodation. Don't come with high expectations & you won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Great Location, Great Staff, Great Price!

reviews.text: If you are looking for a good deal and friendly, helpful staff, the Waikiki Prince is for you. If you are OK with budget hotels, this has everything you need and it really is a minute from the beach in the heart of Waikiki. It is clean and comfortable - I have no hesitations in recommending it.
reviews.title: Great Place, Much Aloha

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I have stayed at this hotel two years in a row and so far, for a budget hotel, it's been the best. The staff is very nice, the booking was very easy and accommodating. The rooms are always clean and all rooms have a refrigerator, coffee maker, and microwave. All rooms have a lanai as well.
reviews.title: Great budget hotel!

likes.liked: — It's cheap and clean and has a friendly staff

reviews.text: There are no phones in the rooms, but we use our cell phone, so no problem for us and there is phone usage in the lobby.
reviews.title: a gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Maid service is only every couple of days, but you can drop off your dirty towels and get clean ones as you please.
reviews.title: You will be suprised!

likes.disliked: — I would have like to have a king size bed!

reviews.text: Other amenities are parking- 5 stalls at $10 a day with in and out privileges and a coin laundry in back of the parking lot.
reviews.title: Great for the price!
A good budget choice
reviews.text: What is also nice about this hotel is that it's close to Waikiki beach and there are several ABC stores near by as well as a Food Pantry. It's also just a small walking distance to the International Market.

description: The Waikiki Prince Hotel is a small hotel for the budget minded traveler. We offer free wifi to all the rooms (at no additional charge). We have rooms with or without kitchenettes (stove top, sink, refrigerator, assorted utensils and pots/pans). All rooms come with:Private Lanai Small refrigerator, Microwave,Coffee maker, Wifi Air ConditionerTelevisionBathroom with hair dryer
